alert.note: Alert for Central Columbia River Gorge; Upper Hood River Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 4:37AM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...STRONG AND GUSTY WEST WINDS TO DEVELOP TODAY ACROSS THE CENTRAL COLUMBIA GORGE AND HOOD RIVER VALLEY... An unseasonably strong but dry cold front will sweep across the Pacific Northwest, causing west winds to increase throughout the day today. Widespread west winds of 15 to 25 mph will develop by this afternoon through most of the central Columbia Gorge and across the Hood River Valley. Gusts of 30 to 40 mph will be widespread, with localized gusts of up to 50 mph in the typically windier locations. Winds will ease slightly later tonight, but gusts of up to 35 mph can be expected through Wednesday evening. Residents may want to consider bringing loose objects inside this morning before winds increase later today.

area.areaDesc: Central Columbia River Gorge; Upper Hood River Valley
